title: very good pencils
review: theres so many reasons why i really enjoy these pencils i didnt start truely loving them until i got hanna karlzons books in my johanna basford they worked well but in hanna karlzon books they shine so like with any pencil paper matterwhen i thought i had filled the tooth of it completly is till wanted to add more shading i could still add layers of new colors i find them effortless in blending everything i have tried in those booksi have also found that you can safely buy from arteza if there is any kind of problem they will fix it

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: a joy to draw and colour with them
review: there is nothing to dislike about this pencils   they layer beautiful  are soft core but can hold a fine point and they dont crumble  arteza colouring pencils are always highly pigmented  i owe also the old  count pencil set with smaller cores this set goes a step further  mm cores   you have every colour you will ever need in the beautiful owl box  my only regret are those horribly flimsy plastic trays there are  of them  colour swatches are on the bottom of the box and inside the hinged cover with names and numbers   the pencil have on them self their name number   colour fastness  the paint on the pencils is quite correct with the cores  the names i wonder who find them in the team koala grey coyote brown marmalade orange  fruit punch  peaches and cream  and  now one of my favourites   unicorn purple   there is not one split pencil in the set  i had a slight problem with my first set  the customer care is second to none   the next day was a brand new perfect set delivered   i contacted the arteza team by email and in minutes they responded in minutes without any fuss or faff the wanted just my address where to send a new set i owe also smaller sets of polychromos they are without a doubt good pencils  but not for me   i  prefer how artezas behave  and also price wise polys are about   and artesas   both are  count  im not an artist  but i like drawing and colouring  i was hesitating to buy the big arteza set because i owe at least twelve big sets from all around the world  but my prefered pencils are arteza  if possible i would give  stars to the pencils   stars to the arteza customer service  thank you arteza for your beautiful products and your exceptional customer care

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: ottimo rapporto qualit prezzo
review: sono delle matite colorate a base di cera ho acquistato la versione da  colori e sono soddisfatto hanno la scatola in alluminio ed i colori sono posizionati all interno con appositi raccoglitori si temperano bene ed i colori hanno una buonissima resa  su fogli dedicati da  g si possono sovrapporre pi strati in questo caso  opportuno iniziare dai colori pi chiari e strato dopo strato aggiungere i colori pi scuri usando una pressione leggera i colori si fondono bene tra loro mentre usando una pressione forte si rischia di saturare il foglio rendendo poi difficile aggiungere altri colori poich scivolano sulla cera compatta si temperano bene e nonostante siano a base di cera presentano una consistenza non del tutto morbida che li rende idonei anche ad effettuare i dettagli sono ottimi anche ad uso amatoriale e per colorare i mandala ma su fogli dedicati rendono bene epossono essere utilizzati anche per disegni complessi  uso fogli satinato o grana fine da g difficile trovare di meglio a  euro buon divertimentoprorapporto qualit prezzobuonissima resasono a base di cera e quindi fluidi e luminosisi temperano benebuoni sia per le stesure che per i dettaglibuona variet di coloricontrosono a base di cera e quindi se si forza il colore c  il rischio che si crei una patina cerosaper rendere al meglio ci vuole un po di esperienzanon si trovano i colori singoliall apertura della scatola si sente l odore di verniceconclusionisono dei buonissimi colori dall ottimo rapporto qualit prezzo perfetti per i principianti ottimi per lo svago ma che risultano godibili anche dall amatore esperto consigliati

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: excellent quality great price minor problem
review: im a lifelong devotee of prismacolor but my collection was getting nubbie and wasnt ready to invest in a new set i decided to try arteza and was very excited and impressed as i started using them pigment saturation is great supereasy to move it around and blend i was particularly happy about the range of greens available always felt prisma was thin on the green spectrumdrawbacks metallics are usually rough and not very true regardless of brand but these are pretty terrible gold ends up a sickly greenishbrown and silver is or course gray not a big deal because i dont use them much the one thing that does take arteza down a notch from the professionalgrade pencils is the lettering within a month of using them the names were entirely rubbed off of the colors im using most often first problem is placement the color name is inked so it sits right in the curve of your thumbforefinger the secondhighest wear point prisma puts the name as close to the top of the pencil as possible second problem is a combination of size and application the lettering is large  which is nice at first  but its all inked over the slick painted surface of the pencil prismacolor goes the extra step of engraving the wood slightly before inking the lettering youd have to carve it off as problems go its not a huge deal i keep a scribble sheet handy for when turquoise starts to look foresty occasionally black cherry finds its way into the browns but did any babies die no its just fancy crayons

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: great value for money exceptional set definitely better than prismas
review: great customer service when i had a fault i contacted them and they resolved it without any dispute and really quick delivery arrived next daythe pencils themselves are fantastic in the past ive had a set from whsmith marco raffines and prismacolours this set far easily outstrips them all the colour range in the  set is fantastic  couldnt ask for a better range especially in the reds pinks and purples that are lacking in some sets the pencil core is slightly wider than what ive used previously meaning you dont go through the pencil as quick the quality of the wax is definitely better than either of the whsmith or marco raffine sets prismas are oilbased and finding these better than prismas may be personal preference i like to lay down a lot of colour when im colouring i can be very heavyhanded and this destroyed my softcore prismas  i just blazed through a very expensive set owing to how i colour if youre like me and lay a lot of colour down and like really sharp points then these are a fantastic choicewhen it comes to colouring the blending and layering is equal to prismacolours and better than marco raffine the wax in the marco raffine i think is slightly harder and lays down a bit scratchy which is more noticeable after youve used theseif like me you now find the market saturated with choices of pencils pens and colouring book to satiate all colouring enthusiast appetites you wont go wrong with this set i did hesitate at first owing to the cost and being not sure of the quality however you really wont be disappointed the colours are bright theres a brilliant range they blend and layer really well and are great value for your hardearned income with excellent customer service what more could you ask for from a set of pencils

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: great pencils at a great price
review: just received these pencils and i have to say im super impressed with their quality  they arrived in pristine condition safely nestled in their tin case within a cardboard sleeve and packed carefully in their shipping box  i have many other brands of pencils in my collection including prismacolor premiers and faber castell polychromos and after testing these pencils i can say they definitely hold their own against brands that cost a great deal more  in appearance they remind me a lot of polychromos with fully lacquered barrels in the colour of the lead and dipped ends  the core is  mm thick so i expect these pencils will be quite durable  every pencil arrived in perfect condition no cracked cores no nicks or imperfections to be found  they hold their points well and dont crumble and break like prismacolors often do  the colour lay down is pretty effortless they layer well and the pencils are highly pigmented  all in all im very happy with my purchase and wont hesitate to purchase more arteza pencils in the future

title: unschlagbares preisleistungsverhltnis
review: wir haben die stifte aus reiner neugier heraus bestellt da wir knstlerstifte zu einem solchen preis noch nie angeboten bekommen haben bei uns arbeiten die groen mit stiften in ganz anderer preisklasse um der sache gerecht zu werden muss man sie aber nicht nur mit hochpreisigen buntstiften vergleichen da sie doch etwas schlechter abschneiden sondern eher mit normalen buntstiften anderer hersteller in der gleichen preiskategorie dann schneiden sie nmlich bei uns mit sehr gut abals unser siebenjhriger sie gesehen hat war er hin und weg auch seine zeichenergebnisse sahen fr ihn viel toller aus er konnte an jenem tag fast gar nicht mehr aufhren mit dem zeichnenzu den stiften selbst konnten wir feststellen dass sie sehr weich sind eben wachsmalstifte fr wachsmalstifte haften sie sehr gut auf papier das ergebnis hat satte leuchtende farbennatrlich reiben sich die stifte aufgrund ihrer weichheit etwas schneller ab als normale buntstifte mit einem neuen sehr gut schneidenden metallspitzer konnten wir die stifte ohne probleme anspitzen es gab keine mienenbrche wir haben sie allerdings nicht zu spitz gespitzt da bei der weichheit eine feine spitze zu schnell brechen wrdeals ein stift bei uns unsanft auf harten fliesen gelandet ist war die spitze natrlich ab aber vielleicht hilft da auch etwas erziehung und organisation wir erwachsene legen unsere stifte nach gebrauch auch immer an einen sicheren platzfazitzum ben und fr etwas ltere kinder sind sie eine super chance um tolle ergebnisse zu erzielen im vergleich mit anderen buntstiften in dieser preisklasse schneiden sie bei uns groartig ab daher gibt es von uns eine klare kaufempfehlung

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: absolutely worth the price
review: i am not a professional artist but do have enough art background and experience to recognize good quality products and tools i have sets of very expensive professional level colored pencils as well as kid level sets i have sets made in europe asia usain other words i have a lot of colored pencils i have been so disappointed with the quality of my most expensive set breakage unable to handle pressure rough wood interior cost per replacement pencil etc in a bit of desperation i decided to try theseand they are lovely the color line is gorgeous they sharpen beautifully small hand sharpener not a regular pencil sharpener the box they come in is well made usually i recycle the box but not for this set  the lead is nice and thick so for fine lines i do need to sharpen them but they layer and blend so well the color name is on each pencil which helps with remembering which colors i use they came presharpened so the first needed sharpening is very easy the wood inside seems to be very smooth so it doesnt catch on the sharpener blade the lead is on the soft side so very fine lines might benefit from a harder lead but they sharpen so easily that it is not difficult to get a nice thin lineim sold on these pencils and highly recommend them

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: buenos lpices pero no han cumplido mis expectativas
review: tengo bastante lpices de distintas marcas mas profesionales y no tanto soy dibujante y me gustan probar cosas nuevas como lpices sobre todo he odo sobre la marca arteza diferentes opiniones y me decid arriesgarme adquiriendo una lata de  lpices porque  costaba   unidadla lata es muy bonita y compacta parece ser durable los lpices estn puestos en  pisos y sobre la tapa de la lata por dentro est la carta de los colores puestos con sus nmeros el nombre en ingls y el rango de resistencia a la luz en general son blandos los colores son bonitos aunque haya segn mi opinin muchas rosas y no son para aquellos a quienes gustan colores neutros  las minas son resistentes y pone que miden mm  para papel blanco estn adecuadoshice mi carta de colores sobre papel color naturalsketchbook de la marca hahnemhle con gramaje de gm he podido hacer dos capas en general y no estoy muy satisfecho  esta escrito que se pueden usar tambin  para el papel negro por esto hice la prueba ta foto y me qued decepcionado porque no sale como en la foto que ha puesto la marcahice prueba sobre papel color negro de talensblack sketchbook de gm sobre todo los amarillos y rojos se ven fatal  as que no lo recomiendodibujar sobre papel negro adems la mayora de los colores de los lpices no coinciden con el color de su tintaejemplo fuerte el color corala te salvan los nmeros en este casono me qued claro la resistencia a la luz cmo esta hecha y porque estos lpices son profesionales tampoco probablemente por esa raznresistencia a la luzen dos palabras los lpices no son malos al revs tienen buen pigmento pero sirven para trabajos no profesionales y si no se quiere gastar una fortuna aunque seria mejor que cuesten menoshan llegado rpido y en buenas condiciones

title: la fantasia  lunic cosa non compresa nella scatola
review: se ripenso alle meraviglie che mia figlia  stata in grado di creare con questi colori quasi mi commuovo una gamma completa per un ottimo prezzo e qualit pi che buona siamo consapevoli che sul mercato esiste anche di meglio e pi prestigioso ma con questi colori siamo gi ad un ottimo livello  ci sono sufficienti sfumature per dare vita a disegni molto dettagliati con chiaroscuro ombre gradazioni di colore spessore anche i colori per riprodurre la pelle umana consentono di ottenere un incarnato naturale insomma la mia ragazza li usa ancora con molta frequenza sebbene qualche colore labbiamo dovuto sostituire di altra marca per rimpiazzare le matite consumate e con grande soddisfazione consigliato

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: a very good set with caveats
review: first off this would be an excellent budget set for a child or an adult who needs to buy budget priced pencils for their coloring books  for those purposes i would highly recommend them  the color choice in the  set is excellent though some could use more depth in shade and i wish there were a really dark inky blue color however this set is more than enough to blend and get colors you want  they are very soft in lay down and sharpen to a nice point which does not easily break as some brands do  they layer and blend reasonably well though not as good as my polychromos do but i did not expect that at this price point  i love some of the colors the pinks and purples and greens are well represented  the big downside to sets like this is that you cannot buy individual pencils when one wears out this is a huge disadvantage to someone like myself  i like to be able to buy only the colors i use the most as often as i need to without buying a whole set  i got this set for travel purposes and it will be great for that  it comes beautifully packaged in a metal tin with  layers  the metal tin is covered in cellophane and then put into a sturdy form fitting box and then shipped in the amazon box  because of this the pencils arrived in one piece with no damage  kudos for the packaging  i can certainly recommend these pencils and they would be great for anyone starting out or who does not want to spend a fortune  all in all a very good buy and i do not think you will be disappointed as long as you understand these are not the same as polychromos or pablos or other high end brands

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: great variety and excellent customer service
review: these are similar in hardness to polychromos in my opinion they are not a soft wax like prismacolor for being wax they do leave some crumbs if you use hard pressure but in my opinion dont crumble as bad as prismacolor they sharpen well good variety in colors im attaching a color chart very few colors had any similarity picture attached is colored solely with arteza pencils gamsol and a burnishing pencil  i love the bright colors of the barrels and would say most were true to the color of the lead they blend well on their own as well as with blending agents such as gamsol they have a lightfastness chart on the back of the tin as well as the lightfastness rating on the barrel only con and its minor and more to personal likes is having the very end of the barrel covered over so you cant see if a core is centered if you have any concerns dont hesitate to contact arteza this set arrived and had the names rubbing off where the engraving wasnt deep enough and they honored their  guarantee upon being notified and sent me a full replacement set

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: tres b bueno bonito barato

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: creamy smooth quality pencils for all artistic levels
review: these are quality pencils and the packaging is great the metal tin keeps them secure thats a huge plusso ive used and own several brands of colored pencils im not a professional artistalthough something went terribly wrong on my order and it took a long time to arrive originally was to arrive on th but arrived on evening of the th being a prime item and was promised delivery on th that did bother me  chat was zero helpi want to specify amazon chat not artezaso shipping issues need to be approved onon the product nowworth the purchasebut price is a bit inflated in my opinionarteza should rethink this increase on pricemyself if it continues to increase as it currently has been i wont buy again im partial to prisma howeverthese are softer than most other wax pencils on the market other than prisma premier thus giving arteza an edge above others on sheerness and layering abilitythese are quality i will give  stars on thati noticed that some of the darker colors do tend to be harder leads and thus blending the darker ones lessensthey are a smoother lay down than other comparable brandsdo not confuse these with oil based or watercolor pencils as those are different and lay down differently arteza has watercolor pencils as well make sure you order correct as i have made that error these are wax basedive compared several brands to these and these are more like prisma than other brandsif i were comparing these wax based to an oil based pencil castle arts oil based run a close second in smoothness for an oil base brandanyhow back to arteza the blunting of the tips i think is to prevent breaking during shipping so youll want to hone the tips by using them or a quick  mini turn in a sharpener will remedy iti had no issue using my hand sharpener to do it onlytook one turn to achieve a pointthese are harder leads but soft let me be clear these are very nice creamy pencils and less breaking is a good quality on any pencilso all in all these are worth the purchase for quality blending and color abilitythe colors are phenomenal i love they differ in all aspects as they add more choices to my collection so you will be happy with theseprice point id definitely say is good but the recent increases has me a bit cranky id rate these around a  dollar usd for the  set  seems a tad highbut im not judging just one persons opinion you cant go wrong purchasing these though any artist expert or beginner would find these workable and desirablei tried to purchase the  set as it was prime item and delivery was next day however once order was placed it said it would be  days so that upset me and i cancelled it because that shouldnt be happening on prime delivery itemsi was very dissatisfied with that aspect and i couldnt get a straight answer from amazonas i wont let that reflect my product option that issue shouldnt really be sellers fault i was bummed that i wasnt able to get my  set as promised right now but maybe ill try again in the future because these are excellent pencilsso if you need them asap ask about arrival time from amazon im not sure if its due to holidays but it was upsetting i ordered them specifically because i was getting next day prime delivery and didntand its unfortunate there seems to be some discrepancy on shipping

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: fantastic pencil crayons
review: absolutely amazing pencil crayonspackaged and presented beautifully in a metal tin box each layer has  different shades of colours each true to its shadeeach colour blends perfectly i love the way these work the more you play with them the better techniques you find too i found many ways to work with them once i started playing aroundon different styles of paper and card you can get different effects its worth trying each to find your favourite to work with my favourite being on the card in the picture above they also work well on canvas card and watercolour cardthese leave a stunning shine to the colours no lines at all left behind all blended well and theyre smooth on most types of cardthe pencils are very nice to work with they do not scratch the paper theyre smooth and creamy and glide across the papercard the colour comes out really strong whether using it lightly or pressing harder for shadingim no artist i love the draw and i get through pencil crayons quite quickly so i needed to find some good quality onesnow these are creamy as i said when doing deep colouring you can use up more pencil than you want to i would prefer this and have a smooth colouring journey than cheaper pencils that do not give enough colour and leave lines behindi did have an issue with my first box the leads were broken within the crayons so when i was sharpening they were falling out mostly after speaking to arteza customer service via email i received fantastic support and was sent a new pack straight away my second pack has no issuesi would definitely recommend these pencil crayons they really are amazing quality true to colour work in many different ways brilliant customer service too

prod_name: arteza colouring pencils, professional set of 72 colours in a tin box, soft wax-based cores, for drawing, sketching & shading
title: light fastness rating on the pencils
review: tldr just buy the premium ones theyre cheaper and for most people will do the trick especially if youre looking for pencil crayons for colouring booksfirst of all these pencils feel sturdy thats probably due to their thickness being mm if you used the premiums prior to these and liked their triangular shape you will be disappointed to find out that these ones are roundi made a little colour swatch sheet so i could familiarize myself with the colours but also what they look like when gamsol oderless mineral spirit often used for blending out pencil crayon is used on thema lot of the pencils are creamy feeling some not so much now i dont know if they correlate at all but i found the less the light fastness more stars the creamier the pencil the more light fastness less stars the more gritty it wasas for if i would recommend this pencil crayon definitely but i would recommend in this economy saving your money where you can if you are just colouring in a colouring book then all you need are the premiums or better yet get amazon basics  count wax pencil crayons they are on par with artezas premiums if youre selling artwork or for whatever reason believe you need expert level quality pencils then you definitely wont go wrong with these

title: one of the better pencils you can buy
review: i prefer the their quality you can sharpen and i havent had it break inside the wood body like some causing the broken piece to fall out and you need to sharpen a lot off to use i also like having the pencil marks hb b etc  all the way around helps to find the hardness i want quicker not that i am speed drawing lol

prod_name: staedtler 100 g12 s mars lumograph graphite pencils for drawing & sketching - assorted degrees, 8b-2h (tin of 12)
title: iconic pencil
review: these are excellent premium quality pencils by staedtler for sketching there are  x mm pencils in total ranging from h to b the degrees of softness are h h f hb b b b b b b b b they are presented in a nice metal tin which provides good protection and easy access the highly distinctive blue silver and black top livery is iconic and it hasnt changed in yearsi have used these pencils before and they have never let me down this set is excellent for building up tone in portrait or landscape sketches for example they sharpen well without splintering and are comfortable to hold and use the graphite is super smooth on paper and does not scratch at all like cheaper pencils the graphite also erases easily so you can perfect your work there is something very nice and satisfying about a good quality pencil like this one this is a great set for any artist or student alike recommended

prod_name: staedtler 100 g12 s mars lumograph graphite pencils for drawing & sketching - assorted degrees, 8b-2h (tin of 12)
title: noir cest noiril y a encore de lespoir
review: si vous cherchez un mix entre le fusain le crayon fusain  le crayon graphite alors ces crayons sont faits pour vous enrichis en carbone les noirs sont vraiment trs profonds les crayons sont jolis  solides et la boite en mtal qui leur sert dcrin est vraiment collector tant elle est jolieaux personnes qui souvent disent il ny a pas de diffrence en ces crayons  la gamme de  de chez faber castell je rpondrai que si il en existe une mme primordiale  lon peut regarder ses dessins sous tous les angles il ny aura pas ce fcheux effet brillance ici le dessin est mat et dun noir soutenubref du staedtler pur  dur sur les photos de mon dessin en cours de cration le roi grizzly je nai utilis que des lumograph black du hb au b

prod_name: staedtler 100 g12 s mars lumograph graphite pencils for drawing & sketching - assorted degrees, 8b-2h (tin of 12)
title: beautiful quality pencils
review: beautiful and quality pencils these pencils are pretty much the benchmark for their quality of material and standard tonal values ie the blacknesshardness the casing material is of great wood qualitymars lumograph  series pencils have a little metallic lustre when drawn on paper so if you dont want any metallic shining on your drawings then you can buy lumograph matt black series pencils instead both kinds have their particular usefulness and none of it inferior to the other i love these pencils for technical drawing purposesi recieved the box in time and in a packaging of amazon polybag the tin box has a little dent on it but thats okay one of the pencils f grade seems to have manufacturing defect it seems it was broken and then was glued and painted over it so that can possibly be a disappointment once i use the pencil enough to reach the point of the wood cleavage and if then it happens to be unusable however there is no match to staedtler for quality art supplies for professionalsan advice to beginner artists it is always advisable to start your art journey from average quality and cheaper pencils as long as their tonal grades are consistent i highly feel that expensive pencils are meant for professional artists if money is a constraint once you graduate into a better and experienced artist go ahead and buy these beautiful standard pencils

prod_name: staedtler 100 g12 s mars lumograph graphite pencils for drawing & sketching - assorted degrees, 8b-2h (tin of 12)
title: staedtler mars lumograph black finalmente ombre nere e opache
review: ho acquistato queste matite mars lumograph black perch ero rimasto molto contento della grafite b della stessa marca contenuta nellottimo set da  mars lumograph normali anchesso in vendita su amazonin effetti questa grafite mars lumograph b  particolarissima molto nera e quasi grassa  poco cancellabile come se fosse una matita colorata ed in breve  diventata la mia preferita allego la palette dellintero set a lato di un piccolo bozzetto che feci tempo fa per esemplificare luso delle varie gradazioni di grafite allora che sono venuto a conoscenza di questo nuovo tipo di matite della staedtler sempre mars lumograph ma di tipo black anchesse in grafite ma di colore molto pi nero del normale per la presenza di una pi alta percentuale di carbone vedendole in vendita qui su amazon le ho acquistate per curiositfatta esclusione per la b del set mars lumograph normale che  del tutto simile con la b di tipo black le altre gradazioni non sono da confondere per in quanto a resa grafica n con quelle in normale grafite n con le matite a carboncinodelle prime non hanno quei fastidiosi riflessi lucidi avendo una finitura opaca e delle seconde non possiedono la friabilit propria del carbonesono pastose e poco cancellabili come se fossero delle matite colorate nere ma a differenza di queste sono sfumabili anche con le dita hanno una mina resistentissima e molto affilabile e soprattutto sono di quattro gradazioni diverse la confezione comprende due matite di gradazione b due b una b e una bio le uso spesso e con piacere perch queste matite black consentono agli amanti di questo tipo di tecnica semplicemente ripassando un sottile strato sulle zone fatte con la grafite normale dove si vuole che sia reso un nero pi profondo di attenuare anche leffetto lucido tipico della grafitequeste mars lumograph black sono un complemento anche per chi ama disegnare con il carboncino le rifiniture i particolari e le ombre pi scure possono essere aggiunte con profitto dopo la stesura del fissatore ottenendo risultati molto convincentiallego tra le immagini il confronto tra la matita lumograph in normale grafite di gradazione b e la sua gemella b lumograph black entrambe hanno la mina di diametro maggiore delle altre gradazioni ben  mm mentre per le black b b e b il diametro  di le mars lumograph black sono contenute in una pratica scatola metallica con una funzionale cerniera apribile molto comoda per coloro che disegnano sovente anche allaperto o in altre svariate condizioni ambientali ed inoltre al di l dellabituale eleganza riportano intelligentemente su ognuna delle sei facce la gradazione caratteristica comodissima per un disegnatoreconsiglio a tutti gli appassionati di disegno professionisti e non lacquisto delle lumograph black perch la resa  in definitiva qualcosa di diverso diverso dalle grafiti diverso dai carboncini diverso dalle matite colorate si ha un ibrido di cui davvero si sentiva la mancanza a livello graficopsora che sto scrivendo noto che ne hanno prodotto un kit in cui le matite lumograph black sono tutte di gradazioni diverse avendo aggiunto la hb e la b le acquister non appena nanizzate questespero di esservi stato utile

review: he usado todo tipo de lpices negros para los tonos oscuros desde grafitos de distintas marcas pasando por carbones normales comprimidos grasos los cont  pasteles negros  bien por vaguera o porque soy demasiado principiante para darme cuenta voy buscando un tipo de lpiz que me permita negros intensos pero que luego no tenga que andar con fijadores para que no se me vaya o se traspase a la hoja de al lado los cont igual se acercaban un poco pero siguen manchando all por donde pasanestos cayeron en mis manos despus de ver varios anlisis al principio me resultaba algo extraa la sensacin ya que no son suaves como un grafito son como una cera dura pero los resultados me gustaron mucho alcanzan negros mucho ms intensos que un grafito aunque el steadtler normal b no est nada mal y no tienes ese brillo del grafito que puede ser molesto a medida que los usas y te acostumbras vas obteniendo mejores resultados y te van gustando ms se quedan bastante bien en el papel no difuminan mal no manchan ni necesitan de fijador la cajita donde vienen en un buen detalle y el precio por  lpices est muy bienun excelente producto que va a gustar a los amantes del dibujo a lpiz

title: no son muy baratos pero tienen buena calidad
review: en general estoy muy satisfecha con ellos los uso para dibujo y funcionan genial no es que sean muy baratos pues comparando con los de faber castell por ejemplo estaran en un rango similar tal vez algo ms econmicos si eres de gastar muchsimos lpices tal vez no te saldra muy rentable porque a fuerza de afilar y afilar se van desgastando pronto sobre todo los que son de la b hacia abajopero aparte de eso lo dicho me parecen bastante buenos y manejables para dibujar no s cmo sern para escribir pero supongo que estarn bien tambin tal vez vuelva a pedirlos el da que se me agoten o intente conseguir sueltos los que ms gasto que seran el hb el b y el f sobre todo y el b y b tambin les he dado caa para sombrear su madera tambin me parece bastante buena y no se rompen ni se astillan al sacar punta pero eso tampoco me ha ocurrido nunca con ningn lpiz staedtler ni siquiera la gama escolar los del n  de toda la vida

prod_name: derwent drawing colouring pencils, drawing & writing, set of 12, ideal for illustrating & detailing, professional quality, 0700671
title: informationen
review: ich bin zugegebenermaen erst vor kurzem auf die marke derwent aufmerksam geworden nicht aufgrund von werbung oder werbegeschenken sondern weil ich schon lange eine gute ergnzung zur polychromos palette suche vor zwei monaten war ich wieder einmal bei boesner dort habe ich diverse stifte ausprobiert und muss sagen dass die derwent drawing super stifte sindich zeichne inzwischen seit  jahren habe bis jetzt viele stifte ausprobiert und bin seit vielen jahren ein freund der faber castell serie warum nun faber castell liefert eine super qualitt ich habe noch nie eine palette gekauft in der ein stift gebrochen  kaputt oder auch nur abgebrochen war ich hatte noch nie probleme beim anspitzen wenn ich fb kaufe wei ich was ich bekomme trotzdem suchte ich schon lnger eine ergnzung zu den polychromos dadurch habe ich einige schon bekannte marken und stifte ausprobiertcaran dache luminancesanford prismacolorlyra polychromosschon vor lngerer zeit musste ich leider kohinoor den rcken kehren weil ihre knstlerfarbstifte leider nicht mehr die besten sind vom preis her sind sie aber immer noch unschlagbar aus diesem grund habe ich die augen offen gehalten und habe bei boesner durchprobiert da ich selten etwas probiere und es sofort kaufe habe ich die stifte nicht direkt aus dem geschft mitgenommen stattdessen habe ich lange zuhause gesessen und berlegt brauche ich sie wirklich ich bin niemand der gerne  verschiedene paletten sammelt damit sie im regal verkommen ich kaufe meist nur dinge wo ich wirklich sagen kann ja brauche ich auch in zwei monaten nochhier einige details zur drawing serie von derwentdie stifte sind viel weicher als polychromos sie sind sogar etwas weicher als prismacolors haben ein sehr schnes farbbild reiben sich aber bei weitem nicht so schnell ab wie die stifte von sanford was mich besonders positiv berrascht hat war die farbpalette der drawing serie hier gibt es sehr schne natrliche farbtne ich wrde sie jedem empfehlen der gerne die natur auf papier bringt und zum leben erweckt hervorragende farben vorallem fr tierzeichnungen da es schne brauntne gibt die bei den polychromos hinten anstehen mssen auch das grau ist sehr schn kalt und warm grau und es gibt einige farben fr details wie iris attraktives grn auch fr bume gut geeignet leuchtendes gelb und beruhigendes blaudie drawing serie gibt es soweit ich wei nur in einer ausfhrung von  stiften inkl wei und schwarz ich muss aber sagen das mir  stifte vllig ausreichen weil ich sie sowieso mit den polychromos  coloursoft gekauft habe fr alle die gerne mit vielen schichten arbeiten habe ich eine sehr gute nachricht obwohl die drawing serie wie coloursoft auf wachsbasis ist lassen sich die farben super layern  ich htte an dieser stelle auf keinen fall erwartet dass ich mit ihnen sogar mehr schichten aufbauen kann im grunde kennen es die meisten die diese rezension lesen werden fast alle wachsbasierten stifte sind zum layern nicht besonders gut zwei bis vier schichten sind oftmals noch in ordnung whrend man bei auf l basierenden stiften gute acht bis neun layer auftragen kann genau hier haben mich die derwents am meisten berrascht denn sie haben kein problem bei zehn oder mehr schichten ich habe davor noch keine wachsbasierten stifte gesehen die praktisch ohne waxbloom verarbeitet werden knnenzum schluss muss ich noch kurz erwhnen das man sich die stifte um den preis wirklich gut leisten kann weil sie sich nicht extrem schnell abreiben wie diverse andere prismacolor vorne weg wer eine gute ergnzung zu seinen welchen auch immer geliebten stiften sucht um bessere hintergrnde mehr schichten oder einen greren kontrast zu schaffen der sollte hier zugreifen ich habe den kauf nicht bereut mir ist noch kein einziger stift abgebrochen ich spitze seit ewigkeiten mit einem faber castell spitzer und einer dahle  ich habe bisher schon einige neue bilder gemalt  teilweise auch nur mit den drawing  trotzdem nutzen sie sich sehr langsam ab um euch nicht zu verwirren mchte ich sagen dass die fotos direkt nach dem kauf entstanden sind

prod_name: derwent drawing colouring pencils, drawing & writing, set of 12, ideal for illustrating & detailing, professional quality, 0700671
title: beautiful pencils gorgeous saturated colours are creamy and perfect for nature
review: derwent drawing pencils are creamy rich coloured pencils with a dreamy colour palate suitable for landscapes nature studies wildlife studies and portraiture i had originally purchased the  pc set just to try them out due to some of the issues i had experienced with the coloursoft coloured pencils i did not want to splurge on these just yet almost immediately i fell in love with them these are richly pigmented and when creating the swatches i knew i had to upgrade the colours offered here in the  pc set their largest are gorgeous earthy tones and the performance of these pencils are outstanding rich pigments vibrant colours that layer and blend exquisitely like the coloursoft and the artists pencils these barrels are thick and the mm lead allows for a lot of pigment on that laydownthe issues are minimal price  these are expensive the prices here on amazon are the best i was able to find and these pencils are worth the asking price another minor negative is the thickness of the pencils may get in the way when colouring in or drawing the tiny details in your pieces also their largest set of  colours may be limiting to some and although the colours offered here are just whats needed for nature and animal studies you may still be yearning for more colour options as evidenced when drawing the unfinished dog attached i had to default to the coloursoft pencils for the tongues red tones these are meant to be more of a companion piece to your other derwent pencils coloursoft artists procolour so for further colour options just reach for whatever set you have currently i own the coloursoft  studio  and artists  the drawing pencils are my favourite so far of the derwent lineoverall derwent drawing coloured pencils are fantastic the  pc set is what is recommended as you get the full colour palette in a convenient tin these are my go to pencils whenever i want to draw anything with four legs and is covered in fur and those soft dreamy landscapes although these may not be the best pencils for colouring books due to their theme specific colour selection they perform beautifully laying down gorgeous and saturated colours and is recommended for artists of all levels

prod_name: derwent drawing colouring pencils, drawing & writing, set of 12, ideal for illustrating & detailing, professional quality, 0700671
title: the perfect sketching pencils
review: i prefer to sketch and draw with earth tone colors generally and ive had a hard time finding good drawing pencils as opposed to standard color pencils in the right tones these are great sanguine ruby earth and sepia are exactly what i was looking for these are smooth feel great on paper and most of them are beautifully pigmented the only ones i found to be a bit waxy and weak on color were green shadow and solway blue but those arent ones ill probably use a lot so overall this set is perfect

prod_name: derwent drawing colouring pencils, drawing & writing, set of 12, ideal for illustrating & detailing, professional quality, 0700671
title: amazing colored pencils
review: years ago i was introduced to derwent drawing pencils as part of a promo and received a  piece set through an art supply vendor as a colored pencil artist i was soon amazed at the quality pigment and feel of these pencils i liked them so much that i decided to recently upgrade to the full  set and saw that amazon had a fantastic pricethe colors in this set are subtle beautiful shades that i could not find in other sets of popular pencils  these pencils are truly the elite artist grade colored pencil in that they are super creamywaxy and pigmented and layer flawlessly though they appear to be marketed for rendering animals they are equally impressive for rendering flesh tones and architectural pieces they work very well combined with other pencils and layer well with oilbased or waxbased brands the sensory feel of these cross between a wax based and oilbased colored pencil but with wider leads from what ive observed they leave no wax bloom or excessive residue the pigments are intense that you can go over several previous layers of colored pencil other brands and easily leave rich broad strokes  they are perfect for final detailed accents on pieces the chinese white pencil in the set is also perfect for highlighting over layers of pencil and covers well on darker papersas for being erasable they will erase to a certain degree on most paper though they do so very well on black smoother illustration board they dont erase as well on other papers but i find that if i apply them over subsequent layers of colored pencil they erase betterfor these pencils paper choice plays an important role they are bit too rich and bold for regular sketchingcopy paper i find that they work beautifully on vellum bristol illustration board and erase especially well on black illustration board they also hold up well on artist professional grade drawing paper that has a weight of lb or more if you are trying to achieve a smooth finish i probably wouldnt use these on general sketchbook or heavy broad toothed paper or you will see a lot of the papers texturefor the colored pencil artist or those with special interest in drawing these pencils are very much recommended theyre well made of excellent quality in durability and lightfast ratings the colors wont easily fade and the leads last a long time important you will need a wider hole pencil sharpener for these something metal and durablethe derwent brand pastel pencil sharper is perfect for these pencilsi cannot say enough good things about these amazing pencils and am fortunate to have acquired the full set

prod_name: derwent drawing colouring pencils, drawing & writing, set of 12, ideal for illustrating & detailing, professional quality, 0700671
title: good selection of colours for drawing
review: i must now have five or six sets of derwent pencils but these the latest are my favourites they are a selection of browns muted greens and blues off whites and other naturalistic colours for drawing and sketching naturalistic scenes i think they are a clever selection you can always add others from the range for bright colours but these bring a sense of understated beauty to your drawingsthe pencils themselves are round with thick leads they are quite soft  similar to derwents coloursoft range and do not hold a fine point for very long i suggest that  you keep a good quality pencil sharpener close by and that  derwent consider making a hexagonal finer leaded version for people who want to do detailed drawingsthe colours like most of derwents insoluble coloured pencils blend well if you dont put down too much at once if you really scrub hard youll end up with a slightly waxy bloom and its difficult to put more colour on the top and blend the colours almost it acts like a wax resist when you try to pencil over and definitely like a wax resist if you try to water colour overif i have a problem with these and for that matter most coloured pencils its the white its pretty translucent which may be what it should be and maybe what you want but i would like a white that was really opaque and you could use for highlightsin summary if youre into naturalistic drawing these are a good selection and deliver theres a smaller set for the cautious but im glad i got the whole

prod_name: derwent drawing colouring pencils, drawing & writing, set of 12, ideal for illustrating & detailing, professional quality, 0700671
title: softest coloured pencils ever
review: these pencils are absolutely incredible they have a fast lay down and blend out with oms very well the derwent drawing pencils are arguably the softest coloured pencils on the market they do sometimes break but the quality of the pencils are very good so it doesnt happen too often unlike prismacolorthey come in a muted earthy palette suitable for landscapes wildlife and portraiture because of this they wouldnt be a great set to start off with but a set you would purchase once you already have an established coloured pencil set to use along side of themall of them are highly lightfast with  scoring an  on the blue wool scale and one scoring a overall they are an extremely excellent pencil that i would recommend to almost any coloured pencil artist to add to their collection

prod_name: derwent drawing colouring pencils, drawing & writing, set of 12, ideal for illustrating & detailing, professional quality, 0700671
title: wonderful pencils for drawing fur
review: i recently purchased these pencils and i adore them  ive used them on both pastel paper and bristol board and they worked fine on both  the white and black in this line are really the best  the black in this is much darker than my prismacolor black pencil  these are much softer than prismacolor pencils  imagine a combination between prismacolor premier pencils and oil pastels  i like the smudgy way they blend  these however are not for everyone  my prismacolors hold a point better  these would be rubbish for detailed adult coloring books because they do not hold a point very well  people were commenting in the reviews that they liked them for portraits  im a portrait artist and ive done a portrait with them but i didnt love them for that purpose  they were perfect for drawing furry animals  i love the color range  its really well thought out great greys for shadows  i do not recommend these for lots of tiny detail work youll be wasting them sharpening like crazy  i love these to pieces but will be buying some faber castell polychromos for my most detailed worksomething important to know about these  they are incredibly lightfast thats not common for colored pencils  all but one has the highest lightfast rating of  and the one that doesnt is a   this is important to me because i sell my originals and wouldnt want my work to fade on my customersthese work great with my prismacolor pencils so i often use both in the piece  the nose on the tiger drawing is the only part where i used prismacolor instead because there is no pink in the derwent drawing pencils set

prod_name: derwent drawing colouring pencils, drawing & writing, set of 12, ideal for illustrating & detailing, professional quality, 0700671
title: beautiful colors  the best white pencil ive ever found
review: these have to be one of my new favorite colored pencils ever  ive been a colored pencil artist for over  years i even still have a few of my s berolprismacolor out of print colored pencils  i use a lot of different brands from caran dache to schpirerr farben  castle art on the lower range pencils  i have several derwent colored pencils  when i saw the muted tones of these drawing pencils i had to try them  i fell in love instantlyfirst they are the typical derwent pencil with the thick lead  nice heafty round barrel  they go on so smoothly  they are a soft lead  you can get beautiful blends with these pencils  the chinese white that comes in this set is the best white i have ever used  i love this white  i even bought the small  piece set just to get an extra white  the colors will compliment any of the other derwent sets  any other set for that matter  ive used them with my prismas castle arts caran dache black widows  polychromos  they worked great with all of them

prod_name: triangular colouring pencil - stabilo trio thick short - pack of 12 - assorted colours
title: stabilo trio thick  la scelta perfetta per le prime avventure artistiche della mia bimba di  anni
review: non potrei essere pi soddisfatto dellastuccio stabilo trio thick da  colori che ho acquistato per la mia bimba di  anni questi pastelli sono stati un vero e proprio successo nelle sue prime avventure artistiche e non posso che elogiare la loro qualit e versatilitfin dal momento in cui ho aperto lastuccio ho potuto percepire la cura e lattenzione nei dettagli che stabilo ha messo in questi pastelli il design ergonomico e la forma triangolare sono perfetti per le manine piccole della mia bimba ha potuto afferrare i pastelli con facilit e iniziare a sperimentare senza problemila gamma di colori  semplicemente sbalorditiva i colori sono vibranti e luminosi catturando immediatamente lattenzione e stimolando la creativit della mia bimba la variet di tonalit consente di creare opere darte vivaci e fantasiose anche per una piccola artista in erbauna delle caratteristiche che ho trovato particolarmente preziose  la resistenza dei pastelli la punta spessa e robusta resiste bene alle pressioni pi energiche perfetta per un bambino di  anni che potrebbe essere un po troppo entusiasta con la sua creativit ho notato che i pastelli sono durevoli e non si rompono facilmente anche quando vengono applicate forti pressionila facilit con cui i pastelli si stendono sulla carta  un altro punto a favore la morbidezza del tratto consente alla mia bimba di colorare in modo uniforme e senza sforzi e ha reso il suo processo di apprendimento artistico molto pi gratificanteinoltre ho apprezzato la facilit con cui i colori si lavano dalla pelle e dai vestiti questo  un grande vantaggio quando si tratta di materiali artistici per i pi piccoliin conclusione lastuccio stabilo trio thick da  colori  stata una scelta eccezionale per introdurre la mia bimba di  anni nel mondo dellarte la qualit la variet di colori e la facilit duso lo rendono uno strumento perfetto per stimolare la sua creativit e offrire ore di divertimento consiglio vivamente questi pastelli a tutti i genitori in cerca di unopzione affidabile e di alta qualit per le prime esperienze artistiche dei loro bambinise hai trovato la mia recensione utile utilizza il tasto qui sotto

title: quality feel nice balance and great to write with
review: seen this on offer and sucummbed to the temptation  it is pricy but when it is on offer it is ideali like rotring penspencils and i find that they are nice to write with  the only problem i have had with previous pencils is that the nib mechanisim seems to fail with me  bit early for this one but im hoping the  works with no issues and lasts me a long timethe pencil is all metal and has a nice weightfeel to it with the weight more towards the nib  the gnarled surface at the nib end is just the right size when holding it  i bought the mm which i prefer to write withat the other end it has a rotator selector for different types of lead h h b b hb f h  i guess you select these depending on the size of lead you end up putting in iti bought the green it is quite dark which is great  could be describes as a forest greeni liked it so much i ended up buying a  pen to go with it

prod_name: derwent34214 graphic medium graphite drawing pencils, set of 12, professional quality, black
title: derwents are some of the best around
reviewer: mz nina business consultant and aspiring artist
review: i looove this brand also all their colored pencil lines  i know everyone is prismacolor crazy but it is hype  derwents are just as good and i am a little partial to them simply they are the ones i learn to draw with even as a kid  i remember my first derwent kit that dad bought me  pencils and i was around  and we were living in australiai love the water color pencils the graphite the ink tense that you can actually draw on fabric with and it stays and the color soft line  i also have a few others but those are my favoritesi would say there pencils are as good as any other including prismacolorjust make sure to get the right pencil sharpener no matter what you use  get a derwent battery operated which is still made or a panasonic or a used huntboston all of which are no longer made  do not get xacto it chews your pencils up and constantly breaks the leadinfo on electric pencil sharpenersi am a color pencil artist and you need to have either a panasonic huntboston pencil sharpener otherwise your colored pencils are eaten  never buy xacto for colored pencils xacto will eat your pencils  until you can find a panasonic or huntboston or hunt or boston electric pencil sharpener get this if you can find one or the derwent black model as it had  holes one for a longer tip and one for a shorter tip  i have both  i had bought the derwent one as i have derwent but also use prismacolor and graphite  panasonic and hunt boston are no longer made no matter what anyone says  i was lucky to buy a new panasonic electric pencil sharpener by trolling the net until i found on  bought a used boston model  used on ebay and paid waaaay too much  it was pretty beaten upalso if you do buy used get one in the best quality that you can and just pay the extra i would say up to   i personally would not spend more than that  i paid  for my new panasonicalso xacto bought out huntboston and all new models are a  digit model number the actual huntboston is only a  digit  this issue is that xacto still sells under the hunt boston name and it is misleading as it now uses xacto cutters which do nothing but eat your pencils  i also do not like it when someone lies about what they are sellingi bought what i thought was a hunt electric pencil sharpener it came in a box that had the hunt name and packaging but when i opened it up it was a you guessed right  an xacto  said so right on the sharpenerbought on line here at amazon from overstockcom but i returned it and got a refund including shipping as they were misleadinghope this helps with those of you who are colored pencil artist  get a panasonic huntboston or derwent sharpeneralso run a graphite pencil through your sharpener first thing every day and it will stay sharp longer since colored pencils are waxy and tend to build up on the cutters

title: h softer than h otherwise perfect pencils
review: so i did swatches of all the pencils i received bought  hard and  soft sets and was surprised at how dark h looked i then start a swatch with h and it was much lighter i thought maybe i just pressed lighter on the h i continued with the rest of the pencils and everything was perfect so i did more comparisons of h and h with drawing lines different shading etc and h is definitely darker than h but whatever i at least now know what to expect from both those pencils probably just a lull in quality assurance that day so a star off for that butt other than that great pencils will buy again for their great price and hopefully more reliable quality

title: great fabercastell leads once one of the mechanical issue was sorted out
review: pack of three mechanical pencils the  and  work fine the  was problematic the lead graphite inside constantly broke when pressing the top to reveal more of the  lead and it intermittently slipped back into the barrel of the pencil when you finally get the lead to emerge and put it to paper i had to remove bits of the broken lead and the other two leads inside the pencil make sure no small lengths left inside then very carefully insert a single  lead and started again this problem seems to be solved  so far  now that there is only one  lead in the pencil this is a mechanical issue not the leads in the pencils these are excellent and produce smooth and consistent marks on the paper used in conclusion initial disappointment from usual excellent fabercastell products but will monitor and report back

title: faber castell tk  fine lead pencil wallet of
review: i purchased this pack out of convenience as i needed a  for my illustrative work quickly i had already owned a faber castell  mechanical pencil but it broke from a jam due to the fine lead i assumed it was a fluke i really should have learnt from my first experience but i had the exact same issue with the  from this pack it took  months for it to stop working after consistent feeding issues either not coming out to the whole lead sliding out of the pencil something i would expect from a off brand mechanical pencilas for  and  they are are fine but honestly dont bring anything any to the table that any other cheaper mechanical pencil or in fact a well sharpened standard graphite pencil would offer lead is nice i guess if a little frail but you can just buy the lead separately and put it into another better pencil they also look nice with good grip and handling but other brands offer that luxury for cheaperlooking at other reviews this is a common problem for anyone who actually attempts to use this pencil i would not recommend this set

title: these are a must for any artist
review: arteza never fails to give good quality products before i bought this product i was trying to find packs of professional drawing pencils that had great quality to them i never seemed to love the packs id buy until i bought thisthis tin includes  professional grade pencils b to h i love that all of these pencils come in a metal tin for safe keeping my other pencils i would throw into the cup that holds my micron pens and primsacolor pencils and it took forever to find the size i needed for my drawing this metal tin is super lightweight which makes travel so much easier and handy theres a divot in the tin for each of the  pencils keeping them from breaking or getting damaged the pencils come already sharpened you cant beat the price for this type of quality which is why i trust arteza products they are all affordable and you get the same quality product that you would if you paid more for the expensive brandsif youre looking for professional sketching pencils look no farther you will not be disappointed by this product

title: they really do erase
review: nice bright colours and they really do erasei bought these for a strange reason i teach piano and i am constantly copying off pages of music so i can highlight aspects in colour for students i find this works much better for students than everything in black however im never sure that pupils should go into exams with books covered in coloured markings after one pupil found it hard to play the piece when we switched from the colour page to the plain music i thought it would be brilliant if you could rub out colours in the way you can pencil and so i found these they make good strong markings on the page as long as they are sharp i cant comment on colouring in im afraid as ive only used them for writing in colourim being brave now and writing over all sorts of things in colour on the assumption i can rub it out later so far so good

review: hard to find b pencils these are predictable in quality which is good maybe the eraser is just wee bit too soft or maybe i just press a little too hard when using it i have ordered these before and used them and will order more when this supply has been exhausted  update i have recently had to buy other makes of b pencil and i can state that none have been anywhere near as good as these by oxford  even more expensive pencils are nowhere near as a good  i have been given as presents some very highly regarded and very expensive types of pencils which have allegedly been used by high profile and famous writers and authors and these oxford pencils beat them all in my opinion  for quality and price they cant be beaten
